etymology.interpretation: Means “yellow gourd,” reflecting that cucumbers turn yellow when fully ripe. Historically also known as 胡瓜 (“foreign gourd”), later replaced in common usage by 黄瓜.
etymology.simplification: 黃 → 黄 was simplified by reducing internal strokes to ease writing; 瓜 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我们做了凉拌黄瓜(我們做了涼拌黃瓜)。
超市里的黄瓜很新鲜(超市裡的黃瓜很新鮮)。
examples.pinyin: Chāoshì lǐ de huángguā hěn xīnxiān.
examples.english: The cucumbers in the supermarket are very fresh.

examples.chinese: 黄瓜属于葫芦科植物(黃瓜屬於葫蘆科植物)。
examples.english: Cucumber belongs to the gourd family.
